info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 22 at 5:00AM CDT until June 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with afternoon high temperatures 105 to 110 degrees. Morning low temperatures remaining warm in the upper 70s. * WHERE...In far west Texas, Rio Grande Valley of El Paso and Hudspeth Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, through at least midnight MDT Saturday night. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from late Saturday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Heat products will be extended through early next week due to prolonged period of hot temperatures.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
